abstract.p: Southside Johnny and Asbury Jukes and accordionist-singer Terrance Simien will be featured at Downtown Saturday Night concert in Montclair, NJ (S)

block.p: Downtown Saturday Night is an inspired bill featuring Southside Johnny and the Asbury Jukes (who are still one of the Garden State's most popular musical treasures) and Terrance Simien, a zydeco-Cajun accordionist and singer from Louisiana.

One of the top live-performance acts on tour, Mr. Simien has a soulful voice similar to Sam Cooke's, and for over a decade his pop-styled zydeco has attracted a group of cultish followers called beadheads (he throws beads to his audience members). Zydeco music can stir the soul, and keeps the audience swaying, if not dancing.

Downtown Saturday Night is an inspired bill featuring Southside Johnny and the Asbury Jukes (who are still one of the Garden State's most popular musical treasures) and Terrance Simien, a zydeco-Cajun accordionist and singer from Louisiana.

One of the top live-performance acts on tour, Mr. Simien has a soulful voice similar to Sam Cooke's, and for over a decade his pop-styled zydeco has attracted a group of cultish followers called beadheads (he throws beads to his audience members). Zydeco music can stir the soul, and keeps the audience swaying, if not dancing.

Johnny and his Jukes also keep the audience on their feet. Having honed their skills playing Jersey Shore bars in the 1970's, and they continuously recorded first-rate R&B-driven party music propelled by strong original material. Now that their mentors Bruce Springsteen and Miami Steve Van Zandt (currently a cast member on ''The Sopranos'') have moved on, harp-playing Johnny keeps the flame burning.
An underappreciated act perfect for this under-the-tent soiree on Saturday in the Montclair Town Center.
Montclair might not be quite Asbury Park, but hey, it's still a downtown Saturday night.
